review: Roku Streaming Stick - Great If You Own Shares of DuracellWe have purchased and tested two Chromecast sticks, the Amazon stick, a single Roku 3, and just recently, the Roku streaming stick.All items function as expected, and out of all of them, our preference was the Roku streaming devices.....with one large caveat for the Roku streaming stick.  It seems we have to change out the batteries in the remote every 2-3 days, and we use it very little.  We tried different battery brands, and we even went to rechargeable batteries.  Then we did some research.It seems the Roku streaming stick remote operates differently than the other Roku devices.  The streaming stick remote uses wi-fi to connect to the streaming stick.  We can envision this as a better solution for controlling the stick, with the exception that the battery drain is horrendous.The remote for the Roku streaming stick will NOT function with the Roku 1, 2, or 3.Our Roku 3 is about a year old, and it still has the original batteries.  But the Roku 3 remote does NOT use wi-fi to connect to the Roku 3.This may be a defect in our unit only, but we have seen multiple postings regarding the extremely short battery life for the remote of the Roku streaming stick.We are taking our unit back for a refund/exchange, but if the new remote for the streaming stick shows the same issues, we will take the unit back, and write off this Roku unit, until the issue is fixed in the future.....but we will not go out of our way waiting/looking for resolution....if Roku wants our business, it will need to come looking for us...and send us a check for the last dozen batteries we wasted on this unit...and all the wasted time troubleshooting a vendor/manufacturer issue...Good luck...
